CSSContainer-name.summary:
The container-name CSS property specifies a list of query container names used by the _container at-rule in a container query.
A container query will apply styles to elements based on the size of the nearest ancestor with a containment context.
When a containment context is given a name, it can be specifically targeted using the @container at-rule instead of the nearest ancestor with containment.
